newsitem.title: JAPAN: S&P assigns AA+ to Chubu Electric straight bonds.
newsitem.headline: S&P assigns AA+ to Chubu Electric straight bonds.

text.p: Standard & Poor's Corp (S&P) said on Tuesday that it had assigned its AA+ rating to Chubu Electric Power Co Inc's 30 billion yen worth of 3.5 percent straight bonds due June 23, 2017.
The rating outlook is stable, S&P said in a statement.

The rating reflects Chubu Electric's very strong business position as the monopoly provider of electricity in central Japan and its acceptable level of financial risk for the rating category, S&P said.

The utility firm is expected to continue to benefit from a highly stable operating environment, underpinned by continued regulatory oversight by Japan's Ministry of International Trade and Industry, S&P said.
